input_text:
Job Title: Residency Coordinator, Advanced Education in General Dentistry, UMKC School of Dentistry

Location: Kansas City, MO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, General Business

Description:
Hiring Department

Advanced Education in General Dentistry, UMKC School of Dentistry

Job Description

The role of the AEGD Residency Coordinator exists to ensure patient service, necessary and timely communication with all stakeholders (patients, residents, residency director, Advanced Education Office), and the coordination/administration of the AEGD Residency Program. The residency coordinator's primary purpose is to facilitate a positive patient experience by managing appointments, addressing inquiries, facilitating treatment plans, and handling administrative tasks related to patient care and resident education. Ultimately, they play a crucial role in maintaining patient satisfaction, supporting residents and their progress, and the overall smooth operation of the Advanced Education in General Dentistry Residency program.

Answer clinic phone calls, after-hours messages and emails – including referrals from within the dental school and from private practice health care professionals; route information to appropriate person(s) in a timely manner and answer routine office inquiries using knowledge of office policies and procedures.Coordinate referral completeness for patients within the dental school and from external private practice before scheduling a consultation appointment. Request necessary documents from the referring sources and schedule appointment with the Radiology department at UMKC School of Dentistry, if necessary.Manage the AEGD Residency Program Outlook Calendar and ensure that all course and clinical activities are kept up to date via working closely with the Residency Director.Assist Residency Director with archiving resident records and residency clinical forms as directed.As requested, assist the Advanced Education Office with resident-related forms and scheduling activities.Inventory, maintain, and order supplies and equipment from outside vendors or university departments.Draft correspondence, reports and other materials as requested. Proofread documents, manuals, reports, referrals and consults for completeness and accuracy before forwarding. Provide final copies for review and signature.Sort residency-related mail and information for faculty, staff and residents; Receive and ship packages for the residency. Other duties as assigned. 

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience and at least 2 years of experience from which comparable knowledge and skills can be acquired is necessary.

Preferred Qualifications

At least 2 years of experience from which comparable knowledge and skills can be acquired is required. Prefer prior experience related to dental practice environment or dental education.

Other Information

Anticipated starting salary between $18.00 - $20.00 per hour commensurate with experience, education, and internal equity.

This position is Full-Time (40 weekly hours) and benefit eligible.

Benefits Summary

Medical, Vision, Dental options, available & active first day of employmentPaid Time Off: Flexible Leave, Qualifying Leave (including Parental Leave), Winter Break (Dec. 26th – Dec. 31st), and 9 HolidaysRetirement Savings Plan with University MatchEducational Assistance / Tuition Discounts (applicable at all UM system schools (UMKC, MU, UMSL, and Missouri S&T)Employee Tuition Discount (75% Education Discount)Employee Spouse/Dependent Educational Assistance and Tuition Discount (50% Education Discount)Health & Wellness: Swinney Recreation CenterFor more Total Rewards, please visit: https://info.umkc.edu/hr/totalrewards
Benefit Eligibility

Values Commitment

We value the uniqueness of every individual and strive to ensure each person’s success. Contributions from individuals with diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives promote intellectual pluralism and enable us to achieve the excellence that we seek in learning, research and engagement. This commitment makes our university a better place to work, learn and innovate.

In your application materials, please discuss your experiences and expertise that support these values and enrich our missions of teaching, research, and engagement.

Equal Employment Opportunity

The University of Missouri System is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Equal Opportunity is and shall be provided for all employees and applicants for employment on the basis of their demonstrated ability and competence without unlawful discrimination on the basis of their race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability, or protected veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable state or federal law. This policy applies to all employment decisions including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotions, pay practices, benefits, disciplinary actions and terminations. For more information, visit https://www.umsystem.edu/ums/hr/eeo or call Human Resources at 816-235-1621.

To request ADA accommodations, please call the Office of Equity & Title IX at 816-235-6910.

Experience Level (if available): None
